page.title: 01The Headland- Hartlepool
page.content: {By Mary Gray.} The Headland of Hartlepool was the original town before the Victorian town of West Hartlepool was built; it is therefore known to residents as the {Old Town}The Headland contains H/Pool Docks and a fishing industry still exists from the Fish Quay. There is a variety of housing including council and private, with a conservation area situated mainly around Marine Drive and Croft Gardens. There is one main shopping street{(Northgate).}A variety of ships come and go and the Dock activities are related to those of Tees-side.There are two primary schools-St. Bega's (R.C.) and St. Helen's Primary.Many street names reflect the existance of the Medieval Friary,and parts of the Old Town Wall still exist as does the Lighthouse at Croft Terrace.
